title: Regency Enterprises - Wikipedia
snippet: Regency Enterprises, Inc. is a multinational entertainment company formed by Arnon Milchan. It was founded on July 12, 1991 as the successor to Regency International Pictures (formerly known as Embassy International Pictures N.V.).

title: Arnon Milchan - Wikipedia
snippet: Arnon Milchan (Hebrew: ארנון מילצ'ן; December 6, 1944) is an Israeli billionaire businessman, film producer and former spy. He has been involved in over 130 full-length motion pictures and is the founder of production company Regency Enterprises. Regency's film credits include 12 ...

title: Regency Enterprises
snippet: The company was established via a $600 million joint venture between founder Arnon Milchan, German multimedia firm Scriba & Deyhle, and French pay-TV operator Canal+, aimed at financing 20 films over five years.[14] This collaboration underscored ...

title: About | Regency Enterprises
snippet: After the incredible successes of his films “Pretty Woman” and “The War of the Roses,” Milchan founded New Regency Productions and went on to produce countless critical and box office successes including “J.F.K,” “A Time to Kill,” ...

title: Arnon Milchan Biography | Booking Info for Speaking Engagements
snippet: After co-producing Pretty Woman, Milchan formed Regency Enterprises. Regency's film credits include Oscar winners and nominees, as well as popular financial hits, including 12 Years a Slave, L.A. Confidential, JFK, Heat, Fight Club, Mr. and Mrs.
